answer:
Shingles is a painful skin rash with blisters. In some people who have had chickenpox, the virus becomes active again later in life and causes shingles. You cannot contract shingles from another person. 
The Shingrix® vaccine has been shown to reduce the risk of getting shingles and post-herpetic neuralgia (PHN) by more than 90% after two doses. The vaccine is given as two doses, at least two to six months apart. Protection might not be attained until the recommended number of doses has been administered. Please speak with the immunizing health care professional that gave you the shingles vaccine with more questions.
Immunization Nurse
question: In a 2 part vaccine and one has only had the first shot is it still possible to contract Shingles before the second shot?
question_variation_0: can you get shingles before 2nd vaccination
question_variation_1: can one still get blisters from another vaccination after second shot
